Firstly you can't play online with friends, we have to co-ordinate and press search at the same time. We also don't like how it crosses everything off for you. Means those not paying close attention can know a suspect without realising and makes you not want to say what you're thinking. Should be all about the clues and deductions you make yourself.
They should add a timer because sometimes it takes too long for someone to play a turn. Besides that, it's a great enjoyable game

content: Game is good. Avoid vanity purchases

Just beware, online games are not always real people.

content: Good game
Great!!
A+

1. Fantastic price for value. The game of Clue/Cluedo you know and love in your pocket! 2. You can enjoy the game both on and offline. 3. The AI play fairly and playing online or with friends is simple and enjoyable. 4. The extra purchases are not forced on you and are not required to enjoy the game but they are very well developed and designed should you consider purchasing. (Suggestion: Pirate Cove or a Space Station theme would be cool!) 5. Stars. Because this app honestly deserves it!

Got this app 12 hours ago. Fun to play, lots of customization DLC (pricey though), great graphics for a classic board game played on a phone app. App can get laggy sometimes, and it can get frustrating when you accidentally mess up your notes (no undo option). Connection unstable - multiplayer sometimes can't find a 6th player, booted out of game because connection lost... Buggy too, quit a game 'cause it froze. And there doesn't seem to be a way to exit the app, other than forcing it to close.

I personally love clue and i am so glad to see it in a virtual game! I just wish that the process of update and such did not take up a lot of storage and sometimes the game crashes when you play it to much

If you're a fan of board games, this app offers great value for the money. It handles all the fundamentals of Clue well. Single player games can be completed in 10-20 minutes, which makes it a good option for short periods of downtime. The AI difficulty scales gradually, and players of all skill levels should be able to set up a comfortable challenge. The UI is simple and straightforward, with no extraneous dialogue boxes and, more importantly, no ads. The note sheet is flexible, and a few basic notetaking functions are automated, which may be helpful for new players. Online matchmaking takes about a minute. Since I purchased the game in 2017, the developers have taken steps to make the app more faithful to the original. For example, they removed former DLC that allowed players to purchase advantages against the AI. The initial cast of characters is all white, but additional models are available for purchase as DLC. As the global player pool grows, it would be nice to see more diverse options added to the base set. I would also like to see more gameplay variations in the future. For example, the game uses two dice - which makes it easy to move between rooms and keep the pace of the game moving. An option to play with on die would be an fresh strategic challenge. Overall, I highly recommend this game.
replyContent: Hello Ben! Thank you for your thorough feedback! Please know that I have shared your thoughts with our design team to be taken into consideration for future implementation. Please don't hesitate to get in touch with us at help@marmalademail.com if you have any more suggestions or even concerns to share. Once again, thank you and Happy Holidays! :)

content: Beyond what I had expected from a mobile version of Clue! I have been having a lot of fun and progressing through the ranks quickly. I would have to agree with others though that only being able to unlock the other characters and maps via purchase is disappointing and not as rewarding. I think adding an option to be able to unlock new characters and maps via a reward system could greatly help the game. I also would love an in game chat option. Even if its pre picked words and sayings, being able to communicate with the other players while playing would create a greater experience for fellow players. Lastly I would love to see a search option in the leaderboards for searching other players ranks. Overall though I am very happy with my experience so far with the game and would love to see the developers integrate some of the things mentioned above.

replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your review! It is impossible to make Clue Pass & Play while keeping a fun, seamless experience for our players since these games are too dependent on keeping your own cards/cluesheet hidden from other players. While others hold the phone you would not be able to check your own game status. Therefore, we decided against it.

content: Great 20 to 30 mintue game. One thing I would change to improve the game (in my opinion) would be the option to review your deductions after you have made your accusation. If you are wrong you can look back and see where you went wrong.

Awesome game. I love the mechanics and the graphics. Each game that I've played hasn't been quick, and I really enjoy that. I like that I'm given time to figure out clues without being rushed or timed out. I am very grateful that not only can I play the game on more than one device, but I also love that the purchases carry from iOS to Android, and vice versa, as long as you connect with Facebook. So you don't have to play with a paid version on one device and the free version on another. Knocking this down one star because I just realized how much battery power this app drains. A 30-minute game can take about 20% or more battery power based on your phone. I'm using a Motorola Z2 Force.

replyContent: Hi Paul and thank you for your review. Pass&Play would not be possible in a game like Cluedo as each player needs to have constant access to their own cards and cluesheet. While Player 2 is holding the device, Player 1 would not be able to see their own cards nor add any clues to their cluesheet which would make the game very awkward.

replyContent: Hello, and thank you for your review! We feel like Pass&Play would not be possible in a game like Cluedo as each player needs to have constant access to their own cards and cluesheet. While Player 2 is holding the device, Player 1 would not be able to see their own cards nor add any clues to their cluesheet which would make the game very awkward.

content: This is a great version of Clue. Yes, the board is a bit shorter, and you have to buy Mrss. White, but the game is the same as the physical version. My only gripes are about the artwork. content: ITS AMAZING AND I LOVE PLAYING CLUE

After playing this game hundreds of times, its frustrating that the game engine isnt rolling dice fairly. On your first turn any roll of the dice will get you into at least a room unless you roll snake eyes (1,1) or a (1,2). The chances of making a low roll of 1 and 2 is only 5.5% chance, yet this game will have you rolling it MORE than 50% of the time? Why are they messing with the random die rolls? Why are they making you fail to get into a room your first turn?!?

Facebook is not required for any Online play in Cluedo, it merely gives users the option to invite Facebook friends directly rather than by sharing a lobby code. Anyone can play without a Facebook account. Please don't hesitate to get in touch with us at help@marmalademail.com if you have any more questions.

replyContent: To clarify, the additional themes are purely cosmetic and for players who want to change the appearance of the board and characters. They have no impact on gameplay. content: Great game, but the add-ons (extra locations and characters) are too pricey. To put it into perspective, I get 7 or 8 hours of screen time with most other games, even those that are littered with interactive and video ads.

All in all a good experience, but could be a GREAT experience with better note taking accomodations.

The $4 price is the full board game version with six classic characters and the usual weapons. The game is very scenic, it has a great mechanism for tracking info, and has a good online multiplayer option. I was surprised to see how many reviews complained about charging for the extras. Did these ppl expect to get even more than the full board game version when they purchased it? I feel like it is very fair. These companies need to make a return on their investment in the product somehow.

Fun game and an excellent port of the boardgame to mobile. Definitely needs an "undo last note" function for the notepad. The squares on the notepad are very small, and the gray highlight telling you that you've selected one is hardly noticeable. Consequently, I can't tell you how many times I've intended to select one square but selected another by mistake, updated my notes, and then realized that I've erroneously erased a character/weapon/room deduction I'd made previously. Unless you happen to remember the prior state, that's basically a wasted game, particularly when you're playing against "Hard" NPCs where there's no room for error.

replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Regarding the difficulty - you can change the difficulty of your game on the AI Select screen. Tap the character profiles of the AI you have added to the game, and this cycles between Easy/Medium/Hard for that particular AI. For the hardest possible game, add 5 AI and set them all to Hard.

Tap the character profiles of the AI you have added to the game to cycle between Easy/Medium/Hard for that AI. For the hardest possible game, add 5 AI and set them all to Hard. The theme purchases are aesthetic only, and do not affect gameplay.

Grew up playing many board games, clue was one of many I owned and played. To see that they have turned a classic board game like clue into a software game for your phone is not only awesome but creative, for it allows for new features and addons to improve and already awesome game even better. I showed my support if you enjoy this app you should too. Many talk about the 34.99 price for the ultimate package, if you add up all that is available for purchase it is a reasonable price being 50% off. Many may feel that this is expensive but when you stop and think about it, you fail to consider that this price includes all current AND future boards, character skins, Etc. This means you automatically get all new addons when new things come out and I can't believe that they have stopped their developing plans when so many new ideas are possible. Eventually you are going to get more for what you originally paid, and you are showing support in the process. In my opinion that's a great deal if you can afford it.

PLEASE CONSIDER: -'Fling finger' or 'shake phone' for dice rolling action. -More interactivity in mansion rooms (or at least some animation). I kept wanting to swipe around and look at the room artwork but to no avail. Some for of minimal interactivity would spice up these scenes. -Enlarge personal deck when tapped on/hovered over (the cards are small and not being able to see them takes away from the classic board game aesthetic). -Ability to zoom on the map/board. Clicking on the tiny game tiles can become tedious, and it's a shame that we can't explore the 3D renders more. -Actual character models instead of tokens? That's a lot to ask, but I seemed to get more drawn in by the old PC version that included 'real' character models rather than colored tokens. -Ability to turn off auto-fill for clues on the clipboard. Seasoned players might like the challenge of keeping up with clues on their own. -PLEASE reduce the price on the classic theme. I bought the app thinking that I'd be playing with that board/characters, but $7 is a lot to ask after I've already paid to access the app. Lots of suggestions, but I do love this version of the game! Glad to see Clue back on the store! EDIT: I've had this app for many months and the bundle packs are STILL $7 or more. I love Clue and this is a decent app, but without a reward system to earn credit towards the extra content- I find it ridiculous to charge so much for a low poly model of a board and halfway-decent character art. JUST HAVE A SALE OR LOWER THE COST. Or- make the content actually worthy of my $7. Lowering my review score until the developers can show some respect towards their customers (since we already had to pay to USE the app). Hope I can raise my score and afford the Classic Board someday, but I refuse to spend so much on so little content. :/ EDITED EDIT: Y'all just ran a sale for the classic board- so I forgive you. ;) Unfortunately I'd already caved and bought the pack (kicking myself now, since the international characters look fun) but I respect that attempts are being made to make the packs more accessible. 4 stars for now- keep up the good work! 👍

The only design function I would still like to see would be an 'undo' function on the detective notes. I have several times hit the wrong box and accidentally deleted what I'd learned but couldn't undo it. Occasionally I have issues where my scores aren't being added to my ongoing leaderboard total, which is a little frustrating as I like that feeling of slight competitiveness from seeing how my score compares with other's. Highly recommended if you like the board game.

content: I want to like this game, no I want to love it. track of players that have seen that card. -- Price to purchase new items.

offline once, you will not be able to go back online. So no more leadership

fixed yet as it represents a significant loss of money for the developer.

content: Love it.

I have loved Cluedo since I was a kid. Having it revamped with a new look  and added characters was an awesome upgrade. Then getting an app version,  woohoo! The game, design, graphics, and gameplay are all great. Exactly  like the boardgame. Love the animations, and ease of use of the app. Worth  the purchase. What bugs me though is there were two seperate purchase  prices for Android and IOS, with IOS being double the cost. Second issue is  the in-app purchases. If I've already paid for the app I should not have to  purchase additional things to such a large extent. Of course I don't mind  one or two occasional extras to pay for when upgrading the app, but after  having to purchase it and have more than half the content unavailable  unless extra purchases are made, is not cool. Still, overall I give the app  an A+, just bad about the in-app purchases. Well done development and  design team!
very fun game

replyContent: Hi Allison. If you select “Play with Friends” in the main menu, you can create a private lobby. After your sister joins the game you can lock the lobby and then fill the game with up to 4 AI players. If you have any other questions please send us an email to contactus@marmalademail.com. Kind regards.

set to higher difficulty, which is a good thing. Users can purchase 
additional boards and character packs now, and as of the latest update I 
got as of now, it is not Pay to Win any longer. (There were hints you could 
buy to give you an edge, but that is gone in online MP. It can be enabled 
for local MP and single player). Overall, worth the money.

replyContent:
Hi Kim,

To restore your purchases, simply tap the Buy button again from the in-game shop. Don’t worry, you won’t be charged twice, as long as you are using the same Google Play account that was used for the original purchase.
Please make sure that you are only attempting to unlock the exact content that you own.

Overall this is a fun game. Call me old fashion but it just isn't the board 
game. There is no challenge. You don't have to work to get to rooms, which 
is half the fun. The card is premarked for you which means you don't have 
to pay attention because it will mark it for you. I prefer to make my own 
observations and note those for myself. As stated, a good game but I am 
truly just looking for a Clue game that plays exactly like the board game. 
All the extras are unnecessary.

Oh, Marmalade, what have you done? You snuck a bunch of new weapons into 
most of the themes for free? And to think I once felt daft for paying 
$35.00 for all of the content! Seriously, Marmalade, I love you. Playing 
this game is even more fun than when I was wee lass.

Every update makes this game better & better! The base game is a 
pitch-perfect adaptation of the Hasbro board game: use logic to deduce Who 
killed Mr. Boddy, with What weapon, in Which room. The graphics are pretty 
sharp, and gameplay is smooth, though multiplayer can be laggy. Those 
interested in dressing up their Clue experience can invest a series of 
gorgeously designed theme packs. These offer entirely new boards, themed 
weapons lineups, and fun reimaginings of our favorite suspects in new eras 
& locations. At the end of the day, though, the themes are merely cosmetic 
changes, and the base game will more than satisfying the average player's 
mystery gaming needs.
replyContent:
Hi Samuel, thank you for your review. Have 6 player games improved with the latest 2.0.2 update?
Happy to hear that you're enjoying the new hints as well. In regards to having Warning in multiplayer, we play tested multiple types of hints in the game for several weeks and found Warning to be too overpowered for the multiplayer experience.

As a kid, Clue was one of my top favorite board games. And being able to 
play it anywhere on the go is amazing. If you enjoy board games that 
require logic and reasoning to reach your goal, then this is a great game 
to try. And for such a cheap price, it's well worth the purchase. Thanks to 
the developers for allowing us to play such a great game at such an 
affordable price anywhere!

The developers are really not subtle with their 80% white characters. They 
throw you the odd bone here and there, but come on. No one needs 7 white, 
blonde Scarlets, with a new version *every character update*. The only 
reason I'd want a new white character is if they paid homage to the movie 
(and they'd have to do a Tim Curry Butler character!). They legit could 
have done a black, Native American or Mexican cowboy character, as it would 
have been historically accurate. A Chinese railroad worker would be 
historically accurate, as would a biracial Black and Native American woman 
who owned a hotel, store, brothel, or laundry. And also, why does the new 
Wild West Rose, who I think is meant to be Native American, look like 
effing Kim Kardashian, a biracial Armenian woman?

replyContent:
Hi Askippy,

We're sorry you feel that way.
The iAPs that we offer are completely optional and don't affect the game play - they are simple cosmetic changes.
To change the difficulty level tap the arrow underneath the A.I. character portrait and select Medium or Hard.
For further assistance, send us an email at contactus@marmalademail.com.

Regards

Let me clue you in on this App before you buy it. It is a great little game, the controls are a bit irritating since you slide to scroll threw everything, so when you try to tap on things in the game it wants to scroll so they set it up very poorly. Next thing you may want to know is about the in game purchases. This game actually contains with Mrs. White, several different versions of her and all the other character, but you have to buy them. And the characters cost more than the game itself at 2.99 a piece unless you buy the board bundles ranging from 6.99 to 8.99 including the original board, the murder express board, the snowy peaks theme and more. Or for 50% off, so 34.99, you can buy the ultimate detective package, which gives you everything the game has or ever will have. Not bad I guess, I feel with in game purchases the base app should be free, but anyways, the one huge issue I have with the game, aside from the controls, is the lack of information about it. When you get into the game you collect some daily rewards, but after 14 games over 3 days and have collected 55 of these silver coins and not one word on what they are for. They aren't used to purchase things or in game nor do they seem to have anything to do with your score. It is an addictive little if you can get passed the bugs, hopefully they add more and do something with the terribly unresponsive touch screen, but you have to make that desition yourself.

replyContent: We're sorry that you're unhappy with the app. To clarify, when you buy the core game, you have unrestricted access to the 6 default characters and the default Tudor Mansion board, so you can play the basic game endlessly. The $35 season pass gives you access to all current and future themes, which provide different board/character visuals.

replyContent: You should be able to transfer purchases between devices if you are using the exact same Google Play account on both devices. Try tapping Buy on your purchases on the other device - don't worry, this won't charge you again, it should just unlock the purchases. If you are still having problems, please email us: contactus@marmalademail.com

I very much enjoy this app and this game.  Online play can be very good, but,  1) sometimes after the first player has been selected, it takes a while for the dice to appear to start the game.  2) needs a boot-from-room function so if someone is taking too long or not responding the others aren't just twiddling thumbs waiting for a response. It's already happened at least 5 times where i was in a game and one person just plain did not respond and the game did not automatically carry out a move or continue on the absent player's behalf.  3. Needs a chat function between players in order to communicate who is still there in an online game and determine as a group whether someone should be booted.

I bought this game two days ago and was playing on Easy and Medium against the computers for the past two days. Today I moved up to "Hard" and first game was a breeze. Second game with the settings at "Hard" I found many glitches. First of all, a computer guessed the culprit after one single round. Tried it again and suddenly everyone's game pieces are moving around from room to room in between turns. I would do my first turn in the Ballroom, and after one other player goes, suddenly someone else's piece is in the room even though they haven't even rolled yet. Or I would enter a room, let's say the conservatory, and when it comes around to my turn, suddenly I'm starting in the kitchen. Also, the computers are able to select the same room they are already in, and yet I'm not.  Don't even get my started on the many glitches in multiplayer. Love the game but it feels like a waste of my money since the pieces glitching to other rooms has happened 7 times now.
replyContent: Hello thank you for your review. Pieces can move between rooms in between turns if they are called into the room under a suggestion e.g. If you suggest it was Mrs White with the revolver in the kitchen. The White piece will be moved to the kitchen even though they are were in the dining room initially. The same thing can happen to your piece.

The game itself is great, it's top notch but very expensive for a game that initially has to be paid for. I take 1 star off since cosmetic items are a big deal, otherwise they wouldn't be so expensive. Another star off for the online hint system. People who have purchased hints have a slight advantage on people who don't have. To make it completely fair the game should have no hints or the same amount of hints for everyone to speed up the game. Sure there is a limit of 3 cards per game but still, one of those cards gives you a free player/weapon/room to eliminate. That alone can til the odds. Now imagine someone who uses all 3 cards in a single game. That's potentially 3 things they can eliminate at the start of the game. Again, this is for online, it doesn't matter for offline since you okay with AI but when playing with people it's just not fair. 3/5 stars. Great game, everything is too expensive, unfair online hint component. Great game though

It's apparent that a lot of love went into the adaptation of the classic board game. But the DLC pricing is downright insane. Right now, unlocking all boards and characters, with no change to gameplay or difficulty, is $29.99, and that's with the 55% Halloween discount. It's extremely grating if you've bought bundles before that are included in the package deal, but you have to pay for them again.  And yet we're still waiting for the multiplayer mode that was promised months ago.
Microtransactions after you already pay for the game? And for what? Boards? Characters? Hints??? Are you serious? Disgusting.
You do not get the full game for the price. You get a limited number of characters to choose from and only one scenario. Everything else must be purchased separately.

It would be more helpful if I could mark who I had showed which card to, as well as being able to group possible cards together. I end up keeping my own score sheet in a separate app, which wouldn't be that big of a deal, except this app doesn't support the Samsung split screen.

Like this a lot. It is true if you want different character packs or board you do have to pay. But you get a board and full character packs with purchase of game anyway so it's not necessary to buy anything else though. Also the people complaining you have to buy hints.....Why shouldn't you ? That's a special item plus you don't get to buy hints in real life clue. You get "hints" so to speak ,from you making suggestions anyway. Plus you get hijt cards as login bonuses so what's to complain about ? I mean if you just want to use hints and specials to win what's the point of playing?  Also I have no problem playing and winning this game even on hard mode. The people who are having trouble I don't understand it. It plays the same as the regular game... if no one has the card it clearly must be on of the murder cards, you don't have to wait until everything is crossed off your list. That's the only way I could see the ones claiming they can't win, actually not winning. This is very fun and smooth playing and brings back the nostalgia of one of my favorite childhood games.

A fun mobile version of the game everybody loves.  Nothing really compares to getting out the papers and game board and playing it the old fashioned way, but this is a fun way to play an old classic on the go.   Update:   I originally gave this game four stars.  I had only played a couple rounds at that point.  After delving deeper into what I actually had I realized there is no option for multiplayer, which would really make this a lot more fun.  Then I realized there is an additional board you can buy (the classic board game), but the price is out of this world!  The additional characters would be cool if they weren't between $2 and $3 PER character!  Still a fun free game, but there's no chance of me ever spending that kind of money on additional characters and a board.

Limited options for gameplay. You have to buy the second theme, the second board, players, warnings and hints separately. IAPs add up quickly.   No multiplayer function (yet?) AI solves the mystery before you do 95% of the time unless you use hints (on your turn only) . Not sure if you can get hints besides with cash or from daily rewards.   Graphics are great, wish there were more though. Player pieces are board game style, crime scene pictures are static and do not move. Can be difficult to select the right box in your notes.   Other than that, remarkably similar to the board game. Great graphics, very nostalgic, great for casually passing time. Just, not much more than that.

Great app version of my favorite board game of all time.  The detective notepad is really well done; the app automatically marks an X if a player does not have a particular card and a checkmark if they do.  So it helps you to keep track, not only of the cards other players have shown you, but also of the cards that they don't have.  After each player's turn, you have to tap the "Continue" button before the next player's turn, which gives you as much time as you need to jot down what you just learned before moving.  Love this app!

Very good adaptation of the game. Thanks for writing this app. The permissions needed are questionable. Why do you need my wifi info?
replyContent:
Hi Godfrey,

Glad to hear you're enjoying Clue/Cluedo. The WIFI permissions that the app is requesting is knowledge of the state of your WIFI network on your device. WIFI permissions are needed for Cluedo as it requires communication with our servers to enable the leaderboards, Hint Cards, end of game scoring and FB connection.

replyContent:
Hi Naomi,

Happy to hear that you're enjoying Clue/Cluedo. When you're claiming your daily reward - have  you ensured that you are connected to a WiFI network/have mobile data turned on when you press the daily reward button? A connection to the server is necessary to claim your daily reward otherwise it will not work.

just like the board game
Good game

Great game, but irritating that you have to have an internet connection to use hint cards. I have both wifi and mobile data on and it keeps claiming there is no net connection. Additionally, if you use a hint card and there is no net connection, you can't move after trying to use it. Exceptionally frustrating.
It's just really fun

This game is good but the fact that we have to have the cinematic of the play every turn for all characters is very long and annoying. And it takes batteries. Would it be possible to have an option in the game to remove or accelerate the game, please?
finally i found my favorite board game.
Would be great to add a notes section
Outstanding. Brings me back.
My favorite board game in a cell phone game it cannot be better
Clue is my favorite game ever for all my life. Not sure what happen to mrs white but this version is fun, I wouldn't mind seeing some 8 bit or classic versions of it.
Great Game. Plays like the board game
Fun game
Very good game, it is just as good as the board game in real life
Love it.  Makes me want to go out and buy the board game again.  Great job!!
Awesome!
Game really needs multi-player mode. If I am connecting to Facebook band my friends, I should be able to play against them.
Old school game love it
Really nice adaptation. Shame poor old Mrs White was replaced by the more contemporary Dr Orchid. Otherwise, loyal to the original.
Very good time killer.

I absolutely love this game! So glad it's on a app now. I wish I could play with other players instead of computer players but not sure if that's an option yet. Took me a minute to figure out that Dr Orchid is the old Mrs white. Still absolutely love it!
Love it, just like the board game.
So addicting!  Great game :)

1 star because there's no multiplayer, it needs way more variety and modes (modified rule versions, additional characters and locations from classic board game expansions) to warrant wanting to play again, and there's no Mrs. White? What the hell?
Upset that I had to pay to try out no Multiplayer game.
I finally get to play this game. I never had it growing up and now I understand the game and get to play it! Thank you!
Fun game. Set aside 20 minutes per round. You want to play it all the way through and not stop mid-round.
great game!!! though I wish you can play this game online with friends. but overall, it's an awesome game! just like the original clue gameboard, fun and cryptic!
Waited a long time for clue to come out to play on phone. It was favorite game growing up. I love playing it..
Only lacks one thing: a speed-up button (or something similar) for certain transitions
Really good game good graphics will keep u playing for ages definitely recommend this
Great conversion of the board game!

Four stars only because there is no local multiplayer (or any multiplayer really). But everything else is great! I have been waiting for this game to reach the Play Store for a while. You should have the CPUs be wrong sometimes and be eliminated. It would be more interesting and it's sort of a let down to have that moment where you know you've lost when they make an accusation.

I love this game. Graphics are good. They way it's all set out is great would be cool if it have a 2 player mode. If it does have one then i have not found it yet but still. Hours of fun. Thinking and solving. Thanks for a great game. 5 stars here
I've been waiting for this game to come out for forever! So much fun!
I love clue and now theres a mobile version and it's as much fun!
Great original Clue board game.
Really enjoying this game
This is a very good adaptation of the board game! Only thing I don't like is the hint cards system and some of the micro transactions
I've got this game on sale for $1 and worth checking out
Would love to see Super Clue version with more rooms, suspects, and weapons.
Really good it is my favorite game ever
Just LOVE it, such a great time killer and blast from the past.

Excellent details!! I love the unique sound effects for each room. EXTREMELY REALISTIC!! Even better then classic board game because you are allowed "peeks" which grants you to "peek" at another player's card. Pay very close attention
Just needs multiplayer, a way to earn hints, and a "fast forward" button to be perfect!
Love it
Great game
Lovely game.  But I find each player should be able to show a card once they have it.  Not only one card per turn
Thanks for developing it so beautifully. I am loving it!!
Fun game. Would be nice to see multi player and a way to skip the animatons.

Would be better if you could pick different board layouts.  Also there is a diceless variant that would be a more strategic option to add.  But overall, this is a great electronic version of this game.
Brilliant game although would be better if it was multiplayer.
Addictive

Love the game and great graphics

Great fun! Easy but difficulty levels make it much more fun!

Old School FUN!!!!!  When/If multiplayer becomes available, the "hint" option should be excluded..... the game has always been won by using your brain (strategy and deduction).....not by peeking, sneaking, blocking..or whatever else Hint provides that sucks the fun from the game. Now that I can play the game. I've fallen in love with it. My family says that I'm addicted to it. Just waiting for multiplayer option now, but I would be okay if it never came at all.
replyContent: We're sorry that you have had problems with the app - we hope to have fixed this in the latest update, please download that. If the problem still occurs with an updated app, please try restarting your phone (hold down the power button, then use the slider). If neither of those steps fix your issue, please let us know. Thank you for your patience.

content: A very well done app version of the game.
It's fun, I like it.
It's nice...but it would be even better if you could play with other Live players

Very good port, but it would be nice to have the option of playing with other live players in the room (I.e. broadcast to TV and pass the tablet for control during each players turn, or log in via smartphone on a website to submit turns). Since this is a paid app the expectations are always higher, but overall I am happy with the purchase and look forward to playing.
guys, if you've been looking for the Clue game for as long as I have, look no further. This is the best game ever! Awesome graphics and it holds to the original game.

I absolutely love clue but never have enough players so this is just great😂😂😍😍😃😃

The game feels and looks much better than the earlier versions we have experienced on the PC years ago. I find it strange that there is no way to play this game with other live players, even locally. Why not? As it is derived from a board game, it seems to be missing a major element without the ability to connect with other players.
replyContent: Hi Eric, Thank you for your feedback. We intend to bring multiplayer to Cluedo/Clue as soon as we can!

content: Just like the board game. The dice part could be better but I like the graphics and its nice the notes are taken for you then you having to write it in and remember some of the results like in the real version. Great Game!
Worked great until update now it's all black won't start at all.
Great version but as said before. Would be nice to speed up or skip computer player animations.  Takes a long time between turns on 6 player game
Hate it
Good game but slow, a animations speed option would be awesome

Always loved Cluedo since I was a child - the happier I am about this well executed app so I can play again on my Android. I'm not sure why anybody would want or need the hint system, but hey, if somebody wants to pay for it ... ;)  A few minor itches:  * no multiplayer option as yet (Marmalade is working on that, yay) * the notepad function could seriously do with an undo function - accidentally clicking wrong on a small mobile screen is too easy * also, it would be great if we could keep the annotation windows open until we explicitly leave it (I most frequently enter a question mark AND a number, or remove multiple numbers...)? * finally, the cutscenes (moving the player, throwing the dices) can be rather tedious as they are obviously highly repetitive - give us a skip option, please, Marmalade  Nonetheless, still love it :)
Doesn't work at all. It loads then shows so weird no signal screen. I paid for this game and expected it to work. Not to happy about it. Hopefully yall can fix this bug. Or whatever the issue is.

content: Way to go, Marmalade Game Studio. You've stooped to being a bunch of deceiving chumps. Great game really fun, simple controls, good graphics and really suspenseful and again really fun well worth the money everyone should buy it you will really enjoy this game
This is a classic done good on Android. So true to the board game. About time also.
Love this Game  I'm glad I finally have it on my Tab and Phone.
Great game all round! Maybe needs like an option for other humans to play, or different character choices, but still really good
I love it it is so Much fun and challenging

Needs a fast forward option to skip animations, ideally just tapping the screen once to skip or a menu option to auto skip, then would be five stars. Please add this asap as the games are taking longer than needed with these animations. Can't wait for multiplayer, hope it will be cross-platform (so I can play friends on iOS).
I've been looking for this game for a long while

Superb. Gameplay and ambience true to the classic board game. One much needed improvement would be to have the Suspects, Weapons and Rooms categories in separate tabs on the clipboard, as it is quite difficult and 'sticky' to scroll and review your deductions at a glance.
Says multipleplayer coming soon.
They couldn't have done better with this. Love it!
Love it! Please make a way to play against friends!
Brilliant interpretation of the original , but the AI does tend to bend the laws of luck!
I had a few suggestions, and the developer was quick to respond and let me know that many of the things that I had suggested were up coming.
Great idea game
After playing the game 12 hours I started getting bogus virus infection notices.  I uninstalled the game and the bogus notifications stopped.
replyContent:
Hi Richard,
Sorry to hear that you uninstalled Cluedo. What kind of virus infection notices were you receiving ? What virus tracker do you have installed on your device? It could be an incompatibility between our game and that particular software. Any help you can provide would be very useful to us in fixing this issue-Thanks!

content: About time the classic game of Clue made it to the Android platform the way it was intended!   Sure it needs a few tweaks here and there, though (if you're familiar with the game play you'll get accustomed to the new format as you play, although instructions are somewhat ambiguous and some elements are never explained properly). But a nice porting overall.   Maybe add online playing options later? (Clue With Buddies? *hint*)
Enjoying but only playing with 3 characters as it takes too long to get to your turn if playing six people.
A good version of the original board game
A new face-lift of Clue is long overdue to come out on all gaming platforms. Awesome to see it here finally on android! Superb work on this new game! Thanks Marmalade Game Studio!!

I would rate it higher if you gave it a fast forward option. The graphics are cool but it takes so long for the dice roll and walking to the room. Its kind of annoying so I can only play against 2 other people or it would take forever. Give it a ff option and I'll rate it higher.
Well it's about time I was able to play Clue on my phone. Still not as good as the PC version from the late 90's
Classic!
Wished there was more to do though
I am so happy we finally can play clue but please add multiplayer me and my bf bought it seperatly on our phones and we can't play together
I've been waiting for years for a game just like this!
Pretty great. Needs multiplayer. And whose this Dr Orchid? Boo! Bring back White.
my favorite game as a kid is finally here and it's awesome
It's really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really fun
Really excited for this! I've been wanting an original one for a long time.
replyContent: Hi tylr! We're always looking to improve Clue/Cluedo based on player feedback! Were you looking for a counter on the screen somewhere that shows you how many steps you have + how many steps it takes to reach a room (aside from the dice roll?) Thanks! (Marmalade Game Studio)

content: Add so I can play with my family and it will be five stars across the board

I love playing the boardgame and I'm so happy that it's come out on Android. You guys have done a great job on the gameplay mechanics and I can't wait for multiplayer support. Online multiplayer would be amazing rather then just pass n play though.
Love clue..Loved the game.. Multiplayer would be cool though

Really great implementation of the board game. Every now and again the game misreads my pressing to get the dice off the screen as pressing to move my piece into a random square. It's likely my fat fingers, but could easily be solved with a "back" button that just undid the last move.
Woooow .. been looking for this game for ages and its worth the wait .. perfect game excellent development
Just like the board game. Fun and easy to play.

Great game! Difficult to see the room entrance, which makes it somewhat difficult to count steps. It would also be nice if other players turn could be 'fast forwarded' a bit. Multiplayer would be cool to have also
Love this game! However the murderer seems to be rotating between orchid and green very frequently, at least to me not sure about other players?
Awesome job. Would love to see pass and play and landscape mode~

I love this game!! I always play the board game version and it is great I can now take it wherever I go! One suggestion is to make it available to play online players and not just bots. That would make it way more fun add a great touch to the game.
Been waiting FOREVER for this to come to android. I absolutely ADORE Clue - I even love the 80s hit movie. Great gameplay, easy detective pad for making notes, great time waster and brain exerciser!!
Awesome game, about time an official version of the game was released. Can't wait for the multiplayer
Good game, entertaining. Would be great if we can skip animation.
Please add landscape mode. I play it on my Samsung View.

Great game! Great graphics, easy controls. An option to keep screen on would be useful. Maybe more options in filling the sheet, to store what cards I showed to whom. Still assesing AI, on medium difficulty at a moment they were all insisting on a single character as suggestion for more subsequent hands.
So far so good, but I'm looking forward to multiplayer.
Neat and accurately portrayed
Excellent! Just like the board game, but with graphics.
I'm very impressed with the gameplay. Graphics are great.
